intro: Helipterum sterilescens, commonly known as the ghost flower, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that are typically clustered in a single head. It is an annual herb with slender, branching stems and narrow, linear leaves. Helipterum sterilescens is often found in sandy or disturbed soils and is adapted to arid environments.
